doGet

public void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  javax.servlet.ServletException
Processes node requests

the HTTP request parameters are as follows:

  • a : node name
  • u : node parameter value (repeated)
  • eip : ZYXnnnXYZppp : expand in place request for page ppp at location nnn
  • cip : ZYX ??? : close a previously expanded node
  • act : new | upd | del : action to perform before node generation
  • tbl : table to update
  • an : attribute name (multiple), for insert (new), update, and delete
  • av : attribute value (multiple)
  • kn : key attribute name (multiple), for update and delete
  • kv : key attribute value (multiple)
  • tn : type node http/xml
  • hn
  • hv
  • direct
  • con : database connection to use for database actions
  • u_enc
  • login : user name
  • password : password

Overrides:
doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
java.io.IOException
javax.servlet.ServletException

Parameters:

ul - A string representation of the node parameters
typeOfNode - Node type

query

java.lang.String query(java.lang.String node,
                       java.lang.String[] params,
                       int level,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
                 throws LazySecurityException
Checks the user's access rights, then evaluates the content of the requested node instance.

- nodes starting with __ correspond to Java procedures

- nodes with other specific names correspond to specific actions.

LazySecurityException

expandIncludes

java.lang.String expandIncludes(java.lang.String s,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
Find all the inclusion marks and replace them with the node content to be included

Inclusion marks are : <<??include a=NODE_NAME&amp;u=NODE_PARAM_1&amp;u=NODE_PARAM_2&amp;u=...??>>

2003-04-19: Change the replacement order to support includes within include parameters

expandInPlace

java.lang.String expandInPlace(java.lang.String s,
                               java.lang.String eipNum,
                               java.lang.String exp,
                               java.lang.String typeOfNode)
Replaces an expand-in-place mark by the referred node content. 

  Replace:     
      Before <a href="ns?eip=ZYXSEQ_NOXYZREQ_ID&a=....>The anchor text</a> After

      where SEQ_NO = seq. no. (a number) of this expand link with the node, REQ_ID = request id of the page to expand
 
  By:  
      Before 
     <a href="ns?cip=ZYXXYZREQ_ID&a=....><!--#EXPANDED-CURR_REQ-->Closing anchor<!--The anchor text--> </a>
     The expanded nodes <!--#END EXPANDED-:CURR_REQ-->
     After

      where CURR_REQ = current request id (reqid of this page)

      <a href="ns?cip=ZYXXYZREQ_ID will subsequently be replaced by
      <a href="ns?cip=ZYXCIP_SEQXYZREQ_ID  in replaceCIP
      where CIP_SEQis a seq. no. for cips in this page

     WARNING  : this use of reqID is UNSAFE because it could have been incremented by a concurrent request
     after we started processing this request.

     WARNING -- Commenting out the anchor does not work properly if there are tags in the anchor

closeInPlace

java.lang.String closeInPlace(java.lang.String s,
                              java.lang.String eipNum)
Closes (shrink) an expanded node

Parameters:
s - the node content
eipNum - the seq. no. of the expanded node to close
